text:
Will the languages/compilers used by binarybuilder keep increasing in the future?
By the way, ever heard of Zig?:slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text:
Will the languages/compilers used by binarybuilder keep increasing in the future?
By the way, ever heard of Zig?

text: Yep, they will. We can certainly consider Zig, but I think we’re going to put that one off until it is easier to add new languages, as it is a little unwieldy to add new languages right now and we’d like for that to be much, much easier.

elements.text: Yep, they will. We can certainly consider Zig, but I think we’re going to put that one off until it is easier to add new languages, as it is a little unwieldy to add new languages right now and we’d like for that to be much, much easier.

text: I foresee juliaception - a jll that's a statically compiled julia library, called from a statically compiled julia binary

elements.text: I foresee juliaception - a jll that's a statically compiled julia library, called from a statically compiled julia binary

text:
<@U66GD0880> Thanks！
Zig and wasm are the two compilers I'm waiting for:grinning: Lets see how many years until we have those in BinaryBuilder:slightly_frowning_face:
